p: The radiological data presented herein are suggestive of bilateral infectious pneumonia, especially viral pneumonia. Pneumonia due to hMPV is characterized by multiple ill-defined nodules or ground-glass opacities along the bronchovascular bundles in both of the lungs [1]. ARDS [2] was diagnosed despite the absence of hyaline membranes (from the second day) based on radiological and histological demonstration of diffuse interstitial and alveolar edema, inflammatory cell infiltrate (polynuclear neutrophil influx), and alveolar hemorrhage. ARDS in this case was probably complicated by systemic failure, hemodynamic shock, renal failure, and intestinal necrosis.
